title: Kasbah Museum of Mediterranean Cultures
description: Explore Tangier's rich history through this stunning 17th-century palace turned museum, featuring Moroccan art, archaeological artifacts, and breathtaking views of the Strait of Gibraltar.
address: Place de la Kasbah, Tangier 90000, Morocco
highlights: Panoramic views of the Strait of Gibraltar

museumFields.bestTimeToVisit: Weekday mornings (9-11 AM) for fewer crowds and better lighting for photos

admissionPrices.notes: Tickets can be purchased at the entrance. Cash and cards accepted.

collections.name: Archaeological Collection
collections.description: Roman and Phoenician artifacts including pottery, coins, and ancient tools discovered in and around Tangier.

collections.name: Moroccan Art & Crafts
collections.description: Traditional ceramics, textiles, carpets, and metalwork showcasing Morocco's rich artistic heritage.

collections.name: Historical Documents
collections.description: Manuscripts, maps, and documents tracing Tangier's multicultural history as an international zone.

collections.name: Traditional Costumes
collections.description: Beautifully preserved traditional Moroccan clothing and jewelry from different regions and periods.

exhibitions.title: Contemporary Art at the Kasbah
exhibitions.description: A rotating exhibition featuring modern Moroccan artists interpreting traditional themes in contemporary ways.

exhibitions.title: Moroccan Musical Instruments
exhibitions.description: Permanent collection showcasing traditional instruments from across Morocco's diverse regions.

museumRules: No flash photography inside exhibition halls
Do not touch artifacts or displays
Bags larger than 40x30cm must be left at reception
Food and beverages not allowed inside exhibition areas
Children must be accompanied by an adult

extendedAccessibility.photographyNotes: No flash photography. Some special exhibitions may have restrictions.

title: American Legation Museum
description: The first American public property outside the United States, this historic museum tells the story of US-Morocco relations and houses an impressive collection of art and historical documents.
highlights: First American public property outside the USA
Art collection including works by Eugene Delacroix
Research library on Morocco and North Africa

museumFields.bestTimeToVisit: Weekday mornings are quieter. Saturday mornings are also good but closes at 3 PM.

admissionPrices.notes: The museum operates on donations. Your contribution helps preserve this historic site.

collections.name: Historical Documents & Treaties
collections.description: Original documents, letters, and treaties documenting the historic relationship between Morocco and the United States.

collections.name: Fine Art Collection
collections.description: Works by European and American artists who visited or lived in Tangier, including Eugene Delacroix and James McBey.

collections.name: Paul Bowles Wing
collections.description: Dedicated to the American composer and author who lived in Tangier for 52 years, featuring manuscripts and personal items.

collections.name: Moroccan Contemporary Art
collections.description: Rotating exhibitions featuring contemporary Moroccan artists and their interpretations of modern Morocco.

exhibitions.title: Morocco-America: A Friendship Through Time
exhibitions.description: Permanent exhibition chronicling over 200 years of diplomatic and cultural relations between the two nations.

exhibitions.title: Tangier Through Artists' Eyes
exhibitions.description: Paintings, sketches, and photographs by international artists who were inspired by Tangier.

museumRules: Please respect the historical nature of the building
Speak quietly to maintain the atmosphere
No food or drinks in exhibition areas

extendedAccessibility.photographyNotes: Photography is allowed without flash. Some special exhibitions may have restrictions.

title: Tangier Museum of Contemporary Art
description: A modern space showcasing contemporary Moroccan and international art, with rotating exhibitions, installations, and cultural events in a beautifully renovated colonial building.
address: Avenue Hassan II, near Grand Socco, Tangier 90000, Morocco

museumFields.bestTimeToVisit: Thursday and Friday evenings (until 8 PM) for a more relaxed atmosphere. First Sunday of the month is free entry.

admissionPrices.notes: Free entry on the first Sunday of each month. Special rates for art students with valid ID.

collections.name: Moroccan Contemporary Masters
collections.description: Works by established Moroccan contemporary artists including Mohamed Melehi, Farid Belkahia, and Hassan El Glaoui.

collections.name: Emerging Voices
collections.description: Platform for young Moroccan and North African artists exploring identity, tradition, and modernity.

collections.name: Photography Collection
collections.description: Contemporary photography documenting Morocco's social and urban transformation.

collections.name: Multimedia & Installations
collections.description: Interactive installations, video art, and digital media exploring contemporary themes.

exhibitions.title: Mediterranean Dialogues
exhibitions.description: Artists from Mediterranean countries explore shared heritage and contemporary challenges through diverse media.

exhibitions.title: Urban Visions: Tangier Transformed
exhibitions.description: Photographs and installations documenting Tangier's rapid urban development and social change.

exhibitions.title: Permanent Collection Highlights
exhibitions.description: Rotating selection from the museum's permanent collection of Moroccan contemporary art.

museumRules: Photography allowed in most areas (check signage)
Do not touch artworks or installations
No large bags or backpacks (lockers available)

extendedAccessibility.photographyNotes: Photography allowed without flash. Some temporary exhibitions may restrict photography - check with staff.
